intro: Stenorrhynchos goninense, commonly known as the Gonin's stenorrhynchos, is a rare orchid species native to specific regions in South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, often fragrant flowers with intricate petal structures. The plant typically thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests or montane regions. Its botanical features include a short, stocky stem and lance-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
